(I'm asking not because it just violates WP:SIZEI'm asking for the sake of everyone in this AfD.) 72.81.58.236 19:13, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Actually, this doesn't violate WP:SIZE. That guideline states: In the past, because of some now rarely used browsers, technical considerations prompted a strong recommendation that articles be limited to a maximum of precisely 32 KB in size, since editing any article longer than that would cause severe problems. With the advent of the section editing feature, and the availability of upgrades for the affected browsers, this once hard and fast rule has been softened and many articles exist which are over 32 KB of total text. However, there are still good stylistic reasons why the main body of an article should not be unreasonably long, including readability issues, so article size is usually a consideration, though no longer a binding rule as it once was. As this is no longer a rule and instead quite clearly refers to the body of an article, it has nothing to do with an AfD. IrishGuy talk 19:27, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Did you just say MySpace isn't well-known?...that's what I thought. I think that about sums up the intelligence of all your arguments. Unless you respond with something original, and stop pointing fingers with your baseless "personal attack claims"--about the only thing you've been harping on the last few posts--then, I am done here. I've got more important things to do. Like run a notable comedy site. And don't get me wrong: I have not ONCE defended my own show. That is not my intention. If this were a discussion on whether or not Joppa was a good show, then I would have no right to respond, being the creator. This is a discussion on the rights of certain fans to publish an article on wikipedia--THAT is what I'm defending. Because it has to do with my show is a moot point. I would never tell someone they had to enjoy Joppa, because everyone is entitled their own opinion of art and other media. Much like IrishGuy's opinion that MySpace and iTunes are not popular establishments, or that certain newspapers are not-notable, yet others are. I respect those opinions of yours, but unfortunately, they don't really hold any ground in this discussion. If you were king, in order to have an article on wikipedia, we'd have to have made the front page of the New York Times. It's been a blast talking to you IG! Hope you've learned something. 24.61.157.174 03:29, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Actually, no, I didn't say MySpace wasn't well known. I said that the place where you were highlighted isn't a well known award nor is it indepedent of you...both criteria for WP:WEB. I think that about sums up the intelligence of all your arguments? Enough with the personal attacks. Like run a notable comedy site? Unfortunately, if you are referring to Joppa, is doesn't happen to fit the notability guidelines set forth inWP:WEB. IrishGuy talk 04:20, 8 September 2006 (UTC)


Are you serious? Myspace and Joppa are independent from each other... Just because I can get a driver's license in California (e.g. create a myspace page) does not mean I am affiliated with the state of California. Myspace is the #1 site on the internet, and the decisions of it's editors are de facto notable. Actually, the decisions of the number 1 site on the internet have more authority than those on Wikipedia, including minor editors. You can argue until you are blue in the face, but until you actually read the WP:WEP and Attack page--and understand it--there is no point in responding to your posts until you can be reasonable... —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 75.32.75.196 (talk • contribs).
When you volunarily create a profile with a group you cease to be completely independent of them. IrishGuy talk 16:23, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
The post above shows ignorance of the word independent and Wikipedia's idea behind receiving an independent award. The discussion is over. You lost. Go home. —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 75.19.159.133 (talk • contribs).
The above is highly un-civil and incorrect. MySpace doesn't give awards, hence Joppa couldn't have ever received one. Additionally, joining an organization precludes you from claiming independence of them. IrishGuy talk 01:27, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
HAHA, seriously? By that logic the Screen Actors Guild Awards would not meet the independence criteria. If you have a hand in picking yourself for the award or recognition, then you are not independent; the myspace, joppa situation does not violate the independence notion despite joppa having a self created page. To all readers: make note of IrishGuy making more ignorant arguments, having a high propensity for logical fallacies, and being an all around dick. Congrats, I will give you the dick award of the week, but because I am apparently a member of wikipedia along with you, do not try to claim notoriety based on this award. —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 75.7.83.114 (talk • contribs).
You are once again in violation of WP:ATTACK. Also, as noted on numerous occasions, MySpace doesn't give out awards, well-known or otherwise. IrishGuy talk 21:22, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
The profile was simply on Myspace because Joppa wanted to have a myspace account. They didn't create it for the sole purpose of recieving the award. Thus, if we say that Joppa isn't independent of Myspace as you do, then the award, not the organization, is independent. The site has to recive an independent award, not recieve it from a independent organization.72.81.58.236 19:21, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
It is good that they didn't create it for the purpose of winning an award...because they didn't win an award. And yes, the award must be both well known (the award, not the group presenting it) and it must be independent as well as awarded by an independent entity. IrishGuy talk 19:27, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Which it is, in the opion of members and non-members on this board, except you. So, thanks again for your opinion. And, trying to double-talk around the fact that Joppa is not independant of myspace is just stupid. You sound stupid, whilst trying to sound like you're making an argument. Joppa is no more connected with myspace than any filmmaker that submits their work to a film festival. Think before you type. And, IF YOU'VE GOT NOTHING NEW TO SAY, move along please. 24.61.157.174 13:57, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
Why did you alter the signature and timestamp of the above comment as well as vote multiple times? [46] That is a clear violation of AfD policy. MySpace isn't a festival. That comparison makes no sense. IrishGuy talk 17:19, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
I don't even know how to vote multiple times. What the hell are you talking about. See my below comment concerning your further incorrect oversation. Move on, please. 24.128.101.14 21:18, 9 September 2006 (UTC)

comment This article has now more than tripled the suggested size of articles on Wikipedia WP:SIZE may they be AfD or otherwise, hindering the possible responses from other users. Please wrap up this conversation. Regurgitating facts simply takes up space. Please only reply with original responses, as we can very well read old ones. 72.81.58.236 02:48, 8 September 2006 (UTC)

I agree with the above statement. As much as it may be tempting to shoot down another faulty, much repeated, rebuttal of our Irish Magician, it's just as well that we let him fizzle out, and move onto to bigger and better deletions--God knows he's got a bunch under his belt. There is no way he can win here today, you've proved it, and if we keep responding--I KNOW it's tempting--then this will keep going on. Let him fizzle. And, yes, the "Irish Magician" thing may have been a personal attack. So, there's not need to remind me. I am well aware. And, pointedly--don't give a shit.24.61.157.174

First off, I'm not a magician. Sencond, repeatedly claiming that you have made a point doesn't change the fact that your site completely fails WP:WEB. Third, you are willfully in violation of WP:ATTACK. IrishGuy talk 16:23, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
First, if someone knows they violated a rule, you don't have to tell them. It's pointless. Second, repeatedly claiming you have made a case against Joppa doesn't change the fact that you haven't. 72.81.58.236 19:08, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Actually, as I have repeatedly pointed out and clarified, this doesn't meet WP:WEB.A local paper about local people with a reach of 8,000 is trivial. It is also only one mention and the criteria outlines that multiple non-trivial notices in the media are required. You don't have those. Nor do you have a well-known award from an independent source. Ignoring this doesn't mean the point wasn't made. It simply means you are ignoring it. IrishGuy talk 19:27, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Sorry, I said I was done...but, it's SO hard not to respond to open stupidity. "I'm not a magician." Brillaint. Thank you for clearing that up. And, yes, you are wrong about our sources. We've proved it so many times it hurts my brain, but I do cherish your opinion. Now, I promise I'm done, unless you happen to supply us with another zinger I can't afford to let stand. And, what is this WP:ATTACK thing? You've never mentioned that before.24.128.101.14 20:25, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
No, you have proven nothing...you simply keep claiming that you have. You have a non-notable local paper. You have two websites where you added content yourself and are attempting to pretend they are awards. You have nothing that even remotely meets WP:WEB. If you did, you would have simply presented it instead of constantly claiming that you have it without providing any verifiable evidence that you do. IrishGuy talk 20:29, 8 September 2006 (UTC)

Seriously, everyone, don't even bother. The article is in good hands. There's too many people on here (MEMBERS and otherwise) who know what's going on. In fact, of all the people here, there is...let me see....yes, ONE, who's a bit "confused." We know he's going to claim we're all sockpuppets because he can't stand defeat--but, anyone who has the means of checking, can certainly find out the truth--like I said, there are a number of wiki MEMBERS on here that have sided with KEEPING the article. Let's end it. There's nothing more to say. We've proved our sources, and he's just trying to lure us into further debate by repeating already settled arguments. IrishGuy's terrorism has gone on long enough. Goodbye. Seriously. Do NOT respond to him anymore.24.128.101.14 20:40, 8 September 2006 (UTC)

Thank you for further providing evidence that all of the anonymous puppets are under your control. You have attempted to sway an AfD using WP:VAIN, WP:SOCK, and WP:ATTACK. You have not provided anything in the way of WP:WEB criteria, but instead have simply resorted to WP:SNOW. IrishGuy talk 20:42, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
So nice of you to revise your post with even more attacks after I replied. IrishGuy talk 21:02, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Did I? I'm constantly revising my posts right after putting them up, because I notice spelling mistakes and things I forgot. I didn't even notice your response. You must have gotten that up there really quick! Good for you. Doesn't change anything, though.24.128.101.14
You revised your post twenty mintues after originally posting it. I am to believe that you didn't notice my reply? IrishGuy talk 21:12, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
51-43=8. That's called math. 24.128.101.14 21:15, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Nope. [47]. Your signature even shows that it was made at 40 after, not 43. IrishGuy talk 21:28, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Great. That still doesn't equal 20 minutes. Not that it REALLY matters. Right now, it looks like your reaching for something to hold onto. I can understand what it must feel like to be in your position. I'm sorry. But, honestly, I don't need to revise my posts in order to make you look like an idiot. I've been doing pretty well so far. 24.61.157.174 21:43, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
All you have acheived is breaking various Wikipolicies and making your own position look increasingly more precarious. You have proven no degree of notability to save your vanity article, which I think you know, and that is why you have resorted to petty personal attacks. Also, I really enjoyed how you try to shrug off being horrible incorrect after being so smug about it. Thanks. IrishGuy talk 21:46, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
You're welcome. Honestly, I wish you better luck on your next deletion. And, please don't take credit away from the people that wrote this article by claiming I had anything to do with it. We've covered this ground much too much. And, no, those weren't "petty" attacks. They were pretty accurate attacks. You can't bully everyone, my friend. People don't like that. Be sure to watch the show when you get a chance! See you around.24.61.157.174 22:02, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
I haven't bullied anyone. It is a bullying tactic to attempt to utilize armies of puppets for WP:SNOW, which is what you have done. Not I. I simply pointed out (repeatedly) the criteria of WP:WEB and how this site just plain doesn't meet it. You decided to start using petty personal attacks. IrishGuy talk 22:07, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Thank you. Move along now.24.61.157.174 22:18, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
Why are you altering signatures and timestamps as well as vote stacking? That is a clear violation of AfD policy. IrishGuy talk 17:26, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
What the hell are you talking about? You altered your post so that it read "Delete," so I did the same with my own, adding "Keep." I also contacted the others and did the same, simply changing "Comment" to "Keep." Don't understand how this is a breach in policy. You're reaching again, buddy. Move on, please. 24.128.101.14 21:15, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
Actually, no. I added a comment. You altered existing comments with two different IP addresses. You effectively added two keep votes to already existing posts. You cannot vote multiple times, nor should you alter comments made by others. What you did breaches AfD policy. IrishGuy talk 21:22, 9 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Comment. Again, unless there's new evidence to add, nothing new need be said. --EndlessVince 22:15, 8 September 2006 (UTC)
The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.

The result was delete. - Mailer Diablo 07:13, 4 September 2006 (UTC)

[edit] The Cheetah Girls News

The title sums up the inherent flaw: the article is designed for news about the Cheetah Girls franchise, be it the third movie, the TV series, etc. It's currently a set of unsourced rumors, and that seems to hit on a couple of categories of what Wikipedia is not —C.Fred (talk) 23:45, 30 August 2006 (UTC)

  • Merge the information with the main Cheetah Girls articles (why are there so many?). It's relevent, but it doesn't deserve it own page. Worthlessboy1420 (Article creator) 06:45, 30 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete, misuse of WP as a free web host. Gazpacho 23:52, 30 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete as per nom and Gazpacho. Also, threre is nothing to merge. The article content is fact free. -- Whpq 23:53, 30 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete per Gazpacho. Danny Lilithborne 01:03, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete per Gazpacho and nom. Michael Greiner 01:39, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete as WP:VSCA --Dennette 11:18, 1 September 2006 (UTC)
The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.
The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.

The result was delete. - Mailer Diablo 07:13, 4 September 2006 (UTC)

[edit] Humorix

Doesn't meet WP:WEB. A google search for "humorix" brings forth virtually nothing [48]. The article itself provides nothing verifiable to illustrate notability. IrishGuy talk 23:48, 30 August 2006 (UTC)

  • Comment I'd like to point out that the Google search is spelled wrong. Here is the correct search. -- Whpq 15:38, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete per nom. I imagine it would be known in Linux circles. Site has an Alexa rank of 368,434 for humorix.org (reach of 3.8/million), 209 unique Ghits out of 145,000. 274 links to, but the vast majority are internal or nl.linux.org, where someone posts with email address humorix@nl.linux.org. Ohconfucius 09:23, 1 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete as WP:VSCA --Dennette 11:15, 1 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete No notability established FancyPants 14:59, 3 September 2006 (UTC)
The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.
The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.

[edit] Romney, WV Churches

the page should be deleted as listcruft and non-notable Chris 23:48, 30 August 2006 (UTC)

  • Keep - although de-listify and mark for expansion. If individual schools can get their own articles, churches in an area can at least share one article. --Doc 23:51, 30 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete - listcruft, violation of Wikipedia is not a phonebook. Michael Greiner 01:30, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Keep and cleanup, maybe it'll encourage people to add information about these churches here and not in miniscule stub articles of their own. If not, at least it makes a good merge target. JYolkowski // talk 02:14, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Keep and cleanup per JYolkowski Dina 16:34, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. No amount of cleanup will help ... it's still nothing but a "phonebook" of local churches. Fails WP:VERIFY and WP:NOTE. --Dennette 11:13, 1 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Comment Never mind ... too late. See Category:Hampshire County, West Virginia. This is just the latest in the local Chamber of Commerce's beaucoup pages, like Streets and squares of Romney, West Virginia. --Dennette 15:46, 3 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Comment Well this seems like the start of an ambitous project to delete non-notable pages of a county in West Virginia that has less than 30,000 people. I mean, who really needs to know who won a Christmas Tree Light contest. Michael Greiner 00:31, 4 September 2006 (UTC)
The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.
The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.

The result was delete, nothing in this article is not copyvio as it stands now. I make no decision about level of notability, and won't salt the earth; if people think Ptak is notable enough for an article, write one which is a synthesis of available sources, not a directly copy of the guy's CV off of the web. --- Deville (Talk) 19:02, 5 September 2006 (UTC)

[edit] Richard Ptak

Not sufficiently notable; he is a self-proclaimed pundit, he's written one book, people quote him now and then. The article is probably a WP:AUTO violation. Is this guy notable enough for an article? I vote no. Brianyoumans 23:52, 30 August 2006 (UTC)

  • Weak delete per nom Dlyons493 Talk 01:19, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Keep if references added before end of AfD. JYolkowski // talk 02:16, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Keep. I added an ACCU review. --TruthbringerToronto (Talk | contribs) 03:36, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. ONE technical book? Not even close to notable. --Calton | Talk 07:45, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. Not verifiably notable, plus copyright violation: http://www.information-integrity.com/pdf/SyInformationIntegrityEES_en.pdf (see bottom of page). -AED 21:34, 2 September 2006 (UTC)
The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.
The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.

The result was delete, and not merge. As far as I can tell there is nothing satifying WP:V to merge. Give it a year or so, if this TV show ever does come out, feel free to recreate the article. --- Deville (Talk) 18:48, 5 September 2006 (UTC)

[edit] The Cheetah Girls (TV Series)

Article about a on-hiatus Cheetah Girls spinoff. Full of crystal balling and speculation, with no reliable sources to verify it's existence. NeoChaosX [talk | contribs] 00:05, 31 August 2006 (UTC)

  • Delete crystalballism. Can someone tell me why this group is so popular? Danny Lilithborne 01:01, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • KEEP Just because you don't like the Cheetah Girls Danny, doesn't mean that the article has to be deleted. This article does have references, just not accesible by internet. I don't think it should be deleted just because know one on here saw the episode of TRL, that stated this information!This article has been critised way too much, just because some people don't like the Cheetah Girls. —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 66.116.18.207 (talk • contribs).
    • Comment I have no opinion of the Cheetah Girls, other than being mystified by their apparent popularity. As for your comment, please read WP:NOT, specifically the part that reads "Wikipedia is not a crystal ball." Danny Lilithborne 01:37, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Comment: Did this show get on the air? Gazpacho 01:32, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete & Comment Fails WP:V & violates Wikipedia is not a crystal ball. The show was never aired. Michael Greiner 01:36, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Proof I added links to actual MTV news articles, that prove this shows existence.now that there is proof, there is no reason to delete it. —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 66.116.18.207 (talk • contribs).
    • Comment First, don't remove the reason I nominated this article. Second, while those articles say it was in production, the show has never been aired. And even with those links, the article is still loaded mostly with speculation and rumors, which do not belong on Wikipedia. –NeoChaosX [talk | contribs] 01:52, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
    • Comment Your so called "proof" leads to two dead links. Still no sources, still should be deleted. Michael Greiner 02:10, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • KEEP I have seen the MTV episode of TRL and just becuase the show has not been shown yet that does not mean it should be deleted. Haversham Hall has it's own page and it was never picked up/aired. Same for The Cheetah Girls. Even if this is never shown, its still information the public may want to know. —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 69.47.130.72 (talk • contribs) .
  • Delete, I distinctly remember this being deleted once before for the same reason. – Someguy0830 (Talk | contribs) 04:31, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Comment You referring to this AfD? –NeoChaosX [talk | contribs] 05:02, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • It would seem so. – Someguy0830 (Talk | contribs) 06:19, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. This series would be notable if it was actually broadcast, but it hasn't been. As a second choice, very slight merge to The Cheetah Girls with a single sentence saying that a television series was announced but never made it to air. --Metropolitan90 08:29, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. Wikipedia is not a crystal ball. If the show had been aired, put on the internet or anything maybe not but due to the fact theres no info i suggest deletion.--ScythedRunner 08:32, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
    • Wikipedia is not a crystal ball doesn't apply here. WilyD 12:53, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. My understanding is unaired TV shows generally don't get articles unless they've been officially announced as airing. The fact this show was commissioned and then basically cancelled (it's been 2 years, I'd say that's a safe assumption) disqualifies it from getting an article. Merge information of interest into the main Cheetah Girls article. (What's with all the Cheetahcruft we've been seeing lately? 23skidoo 13:13, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete or a best merge to The Cheetah Girls. It's an unaired TV show with very scant information about it. If it does get to air, then by all means recreate the article with facts. -- Whpq 15:35, 31 August 2006 (UTC)
  • Delete. Fails WP:V (the first two links have expired). Disney has release three Cheetah Girls movies, and this is just a re-hash of a Very Old article that speculated that the series would be premiering in 2004 ... looks like they went in Another Direction with the property, and previous plans are not worthy of mention here. An why bother to merge a show that never happened to a disambiguation page, anyway? --Dennette 11:05, 1 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Keep There is an article at MTV News that has tons of information on The Cheetah Girls TV Series, but if you click on the link it says the article is deletes, but you can type in The Cheetah Girls TV Series or just the Cheetah Girls, in the search bar and the article will show up when you click on the link. there is your evidence and reference. —The preceding unsigned comment was added by 66.116.18.207 (talk • contribs).
  • Delete, fails WP:V. I decided to use Star Trek: Phase II as a litmus test. The content there shows how scripts were adapted either into the motion picture or The Next Generation episodes, how characters were adapted into the movies, etc. There was a lot of factual evidence, including quoted statements about the show from production personnel. By contast, a lot of information here is speculative. Plus, if four episodes were in the can, at least the episode titles should be out there somewhere. I just don't see there being enough factual evidence here for the article to stand. —C.Fred (talk) 18:12, 3 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Comment Um, this article got moved to The Cheetah Girls Sitcom. Is that allowed? Should this AfD be updated to reflect this? –NeoChaosX [talk | contribs] 23:22, 3 September 2006 (UTC)
    • Comment And now it's been moved to The Cheetah Girls: The Series. Seriously, is this kind of moving an article that's marked for deletion allowed? –NeoChaosX [talk | contribs] 00:24, 5 September 2006 (UTC)
  • KEEP There is more than one link proof that the show was once in production and if deleted then it should me somewhat merged with the girl groups info. Jtervin 00:34, 4 September 2006 (UTC)
  • Merge This doesn't need to be an article, just put a short section about it in The Cheetah Girls.--KojiDude 01:34, 5 September 2006 (UTC)
The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. Please do not modify it. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a deletion review). No further edits should be made to this page.

The result was delete. - Mailer Diablo 07:14, 4 September 2006 (UTC)
